title: BougeRV’s telescopic lantern is ridiculously versatile
snippets: The BougeRV LED lantern is marketed as an outdoor camplight but functions as a versatile, multifunctional work lamp. It features a rechargeable, compact design and three adjustable LED panels that emit 3000 lumens, suitable for illuminating various settings like campsites, workspaces, or engine blocks.
summary: The BougeRV LED lantern is a versatile, rechargeable lamp designed for outdoor camping and various work environments. It has a compact design with three adjustable LED panels that provide 3000 lumens, making it suitable for lighting up campsites, workspaces, or engine blocks.

title: Judge saves the CFPB, for now
snippets: On Friday, Judge Amy Berman Jackson issued a preliminary injunction preventing the Trump administration and the Department of Government Efficiency from dismantling the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) during ongoing legal proceedings.
summary: On Friday, Judge Amy Berman Jackson issued a preliminary injunction to stop the Trump administration and the Department of Government Efficiency from dismantling the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) while legal proceedings are ongoing.

title: Windows 11 is closing a loophole that let you skip making a Microsoft account
snippets: Microsoft has updated its Windows 11 Insider Preview to remove a bypass script that allowed users to set up the operating system without an internet connection and logging in. This change enforces the requirement for all Windows 11 devices to be connected to the internet and logged into an account during setup.
summary: Microsoft updated its Windows 11 Insider Preview, eliminating a script that let users install the OS without an internet connection and without logging in. Now, setting up Windows 11 requires both an internet connection and account login.

title: The 30 best Amazon Big Spring Sale deals under $30
snippets: Amazon's Big Spring Sale is currently underway, ending on Monday, March 31st. The sale features dozens of deals accessible without an Amazon Prime membership. A comprehensive roundup includes over 100 deals on popular gear, alongside a selection of low-cost alternatives.

title: Elon Musk’s xAI buys Elon Musk’s X for $33 billion on paper
snippets: Elon Musk's AI company, xAI, has acquired the social media platform X (previously Twitter) in an all-stock deal. The transaction values xAI at $80 billion and X at $33 billion, incorporating $12 billion of X's debt. This acquisition comes a few years after Musk originally purchased Twitter for $44 billion.
summary: Elon Musk's AI company, xAI, has acquired the social media platform X (formerly known as Twitter) in an all-stock transaction. The deal values xAI at $80 billion and X at $33 billion, which includes $12 billion of X's debt. This move follows Musk's initial purchase of Twitter for $44 billion a few years ago.

title: Microsoft tests Quick Machine Recovery to restore PCs that can’t boot
snippets: Microsoft has begun testing Quick Machine Recovery in its latest Windows Insider Preview build (6120.3653) for Windows 11 devices. This feature, designed to enhance IT professionals' ability to remotely recover devices that won't boot, was first announced last year following the Crowdstrike incident.
summary: Microsoft has introduced Quick Machine Recovery in its new Windows Insider Preview build (6120.3653) for Windows 11, aimed at helping IT professionals remotely fix devices that fail to boot. This feature, announced after the Crowdstrike incident last year, is currently in the testing phase.

title: New approach could treat anthrax beyond the 'point of no return'

title: AI meets oncology: New model personalizes bladder cancer treatment
snippets: Researchers have created an advanced AI model that improves predictions on chemotherapy responses in muscle-invasive bladder cancer patients. This model uniquely combines whole-slide tumor imaging data with gene expression analyses, achieving better accuracy than prior models based on a single data type.
summary: Researchers developed an AI model that enhances the prediction of chemotherapy outcomes for muscle-invasive bladder cancer patients. This model merges whole-slide tumor images with gene expression data, resulting in higher accuracy compared to previous models that relied on only one type of data.

title: PET imaging confirms direct involvement of dopamine in cognitive flexibility
snippets: Scientists have discovered a connection between dopamine levels in the brain and cognitive flexibility, finding that increased dopamine production improves task efficiency. This was observed using PET imaging during challenging cognitive tasks. This discovery could lead to more targeted treatments for neurological and psychiatric disorders.
summary: Scientists have found that higher dopamine levels in the brain are linked to improved cognitive flexibility and task efficiency, as observed through PET imaging during difficult cognitive tasks. This discovery opens potential pathways for more precise treatments for neurological and psychiatric disorders.

title: Understanding the immune response to a persistent pathogen
snippets: Researchers have discovered that the immune system can identify and manage the dormant phase of Toxoplasma gondii, a parasite. This insight could aid in understanding how other nervous system infections remain latent.
summary: Researchers have found that the immune system can recognize and control the inactive stage of Toxoplasma gondii, a parasite. This discovery may help understand how infections in the nervous system stay dormant.

title: Global patterns in seed plant distribution over millions of years
snippets: A study analyzing nearly 270,000 seed plant species globally has identified environmental conditions and dispersal barriers as key factors influencing plant distributions and diversity. This research sheds light on why certain plants flourish in specific regions while others do not, tracing these patterns over millions of years.
summary: A global study of nearly 270,000 seed plant species has found that environmental conditions and dispersal barriers are crucial in determining where plants thrive and their diversity.
